Key Match Events: Ferran Torres swept the ball past Thomas Strakosha and that, it seemed, was that, 13 minutes in.
Pre-Game Insights: Sylvinho, Albabia’s coach, had said they would put four past us in the first game, five in the second, and we wouldn’t show up for the third, but they did show up.
Post-Match Reflections: Sylvinho insisted he was proud of his team and that an experience like this was worth losing sleep over.
Albania’s coach left with ‘gold’: ‘an experience I wouldn’t change for anything’.
Spain left with nine points from nine, no goals conceded, for the first time.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Thousands had come to enjoy this and their team had come to compete too.
A young fan ran on to the pitch.
The flares may bring another fine for a federation already hit with €84,875 (£72,000) worth of them.
Others: Albania, who began with players from eight leagues, are the most international team here.
They are also a brave one, a side that scored after 23 seconds against Italy and late against Croatia went for Spain.
